analyzed: dam tshig de ni bde bar gshegs kyis gnang //

original: zhes so // byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis lha'i lo stong phrag brgyad cur de bzhin gshegs pa stong phrag brgyad cu rnams re re yang stong phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor dang ldan pa rnams la lha rdzas kyi mal stan dang nad pa'i gsos sman dang yo byad rnams kyis bsnyen bkur
analyzed: zhes so // byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis lha'i lo stong phrag brgyad cur de bzhin gshegs pa stong phrag brgyad cu rnams re re yang stong phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor dang ldan pa rnams la lha rdzas kyi mal stan dang nad pa'i gsos sman dang yo byad rnams kyis bsnyen bkur
translated: One bodhisattva for 80,000 divine years serves 80,000 Tathagatas, each with an entourage of 80,000, with divine bedding, seats, medicine for curing the ill, and with utensils.

original: byed do // gzhan yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las byung nas sems can 'di rnams bdag gis sangs rgyas la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bdag nyid kho na nye bar longs spyod do //
analyzed: byed do // gzhan yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las byung nas sems can 'di rnams bdag gis sangs rgyas la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bdag nyid kho na nye bar longs spyod do //
translated: Moreover, he thinks, “I will establish these sentient beings in Buddhahood, after they have arisen from the cause of suffering,” and he himself enjoys the use of them.

original: de nas snga ma'i byang chub sems dpa' las byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi phung po skye bar 'gyur ro zhes theg pa chen po'i mdo las so //
analyzed: de nas snga ma'i byang chub sems dpa' las byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi phung po skye bar 'gyur ro zhes theg pa chen po'i mdo las so //
translated: Then the mass of merit of the bodhisattva who is later born becomes greater than that of the former bodhisattva. This is stated in the Mahayana sutras.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gang zag kha dog dang dri dang ro las kyang dpyad nas rang la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar longs spyod do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gang zag kha dog dang dri dang ro las kyang dpyad nas rang la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar longs spyod do //
translated: The person of the Śrāvaka Vehicle enjoys [the body] by way of the aspects of self, etc., after analyzing it into color, smell, taste, and tactile sensations.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la mngon par brtson pas kyang mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas bdag gi lus la gang srin bu'i rigs brgya phrag brgyad cu gnas pa rnams tshim par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la mngon par brtson pas kyang mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas bdag gi lus la gang srin bu'i rigs brgya phrag brgyad cu gnas pa rnams tshim par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The one who is intent on the Vehicle of the Perfections, while still on the stage of action in faith, thinks, “I will satisfy the eighty-eight thousand families of worms that live in my body.”

original: sa thob pas yang sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi gzugs kyis rang rig pa'i rnam pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sa thob pas yang sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi gzugs kyis rang rig pa'i rnam pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The one who has attained the stages [of the Bodhisattva], by means of the forms of an illusion or dream, enjoys [the body] by way of the aspects of self-awareness, and the three spheres are completely purified.

original: sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa la spyod pa yang rdzogs pa'i rim pas bza' ba la yang shin tu dang ches shin tu ba yod do //
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa la spyod pa yang rdzogs pa'i rim pas bza' ba la yang shin tu dang ches shin tu ba yod do //
translated: The one who practices the Mantra Vehicle also has a very great and extremely great enjoyment of the body by means of the perfection stage.

original: gsungs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also said:

original: gang rnams mthong dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: gang rnams mthong dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Those who are endowed with the vision of the truth,

original: rnam pa kun tu mchod pa yang //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu mchod pa yang //
translated: and who make offerings in every way,

original: de rnams mthong dang mchod pa yis //
analyzed: de rnams mthong dang mchod pa yis //
translated: by seeing them and making offerings to them,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: all the buddhas.

original: de nas zhes pa la gal te bcom ldan 'das chos ston pa yin na rtog pa yang mnga' ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la gal te bcom ldan 'das chos ston pa yin na rtog pa yang mnga' ste /
translated: Then, if the Lord teaches the Dharma, he also has conceptualization,

original: ma dpyad par ston pa ma yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dpyad par ston pa ma yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a tenet that he does not teach without analysis.

original: de ltar na yang dngos po @142b thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'gal ba'i ma rig pa'i ngo bo rnam par rtog pas khyab la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dngos po @142b thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'gal ba'i ma rig pa'i ngo bo rnam par rtog pas khyab la /
translated: But even so, he is contradicted by omniscience, which is characterized by the direct perception of the reality of all things, because he is pervaded by conceptualization, which is the essence of ignorance.

original: dag ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: dag ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Since the pervasion by contradiction is perceived, he is not omniscient.

original: phyag na rdo rje ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: Vajrapani is the Great Vajra-holder.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: All the Vajra-holders are all the Tathagatas.

original: nyid kyang gang sku la sogs pa rnams te sku la sogs pa'i snying po rnams so //
analyzed: nyid kyang gang sku la sogs pa rnams te sku la sogs pa'i snying po rnams so //
translated: His own body, etc., are the essences of body, etc.

original: de rnams gnyis su med pas mnyam pa nyid yin te de nyid rdo rje yin pa ni tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams gnyis su med pas mnyam pa nyid yin te de nyid rdo rje yin pa ni tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since those are nondual, they are sameness. That itself is the vajra, because it is established by valid cognition and scripture.

original: dgongs nas zhes pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis nges par byas nas so //
analyzed: dgongs nas zhes pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis nges par byas nas so //
translated: Having reflected means having ascertained with pure mundane gnosis.

original: cang mi gsung ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: cang mi gsung ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: Silence means possessing the state of supramundane nonconceptual gnosis.

original: 'di nyid nga'i rang bzhin te bstan pa ni kun rdzob tu sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis rtogs pa med na yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid nga'i rang bzhin te bstan pa ni kun rdzob tu sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis rtogs pa med na yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: This itself is my nature, which is taught conventionally, is due to the power of former aspirations, even without realization, it will engage.

original: de nas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ma yin par shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de nas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ma yin par shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Then it would follow that he is not omniscient. It is for the purpose of understanding that he is not so.

original: ci ltar 'di dag le'u gsum par thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i skabs su de bzhin du kho bos rab tu bsgrubs pas 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: ci ltar 'di dag le'u gsum par thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i skabs su de bzhin du kho bos rab tu bsgrubs pas 'dir ma spros so //
translated: Just as these were established in chapter three in the context of establishing omniscience, I have established them in the same way, so I will not elaborate on them here.

original: gang rnams 'di'i don rang gis shes par mi nus pas cang mi gsung par gyur pa la gzhan du rtog par byed do /
analyzed: gang rnams 'di'i don rang gis shes par mi nus pas cang mi gsung par gyur pa la gzhan du rtog par byed do /
translated: Those who are unable to understand the meaning of this by themselves, who remain silent, will imagine it in other ways.

original: de shes par bya ba'i don du de la bsams nas 'di ci'i slad du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de shes par bya ba'i don du de la bsams nas 'di ci'i slad du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to make that known, he says, “Why is it that . . . ?” and so forth.

original: 'di'i don ni cang mi gsung bar gyur pa bstan pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni cang mi gsung bar gyur pa bstan pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'am /
translated: The meaning of this is that the cause of the complete teaching is the silence.

original: de la nus pa med pa'am de la gdul bya snod du gyur pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de la nus pa med pa'am de la gdul bya snod du gyur pa med pa yin /
translated: Or, it is that he is not able to do that, or that there are no disciples who are fit vessels for that.

original: de la re zhig dang po ni ma yin te de yongs su rdzogs pa ni yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po ni ma yin te de yongs su rdzogs pa ni yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not the case that the complete teaching is the cause of the silence, because it is complete.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the second,

original: gang gsungs pa thams cad ces pa nas rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes pa la thug pas so //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa thams cad ces pa nas rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes pa la thug pas so //
translated: because it says, “everything that has been taught . . . up to . . . Vajradhara.”

original: gsum pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the third,

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: because it says,

original: nang na zhes pa la thug pas so //
analyzed: nang na zhes pa la thug pas so //
translated: “within . . . up to . . . ”

original: de rnams nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas de kho na nyid du gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rtogs par bya bar bzhed nas gsungs pa yin te🔽/ sku rdo rje la sogs @143a * //
analyzed: de rnams nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas de kho na nyid du gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rtogs par bya bar bzhed nas gsungs pa yin te / sku rdo rje la sogs @143a * //
translated: Since those very things are the nature of supramundane nondual exalted wisdom, the Bhagavans, intending to realize them, taught them from the perspective of refuting the superimposition of apprehended object and apprehending subject in reality.

original: pa rnams la brtags pa dmigs su med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes myong ba'i bdag nyid gang gi rang bzhin de yin no //
analyzed: pa rnams la brtags pa dmigs su med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes myong ba'i bdag nyid gang gi rang bzhin de yin no //
translated: The nature of those, such as vajra body, is nonobservation of imputation and the nature of the experience of nondual exalted wisdom.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pas na mi 'gyur ba yang yin la rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gnas kyang yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pas na mi 'gyur ba yang yin la rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gnas kyang yin no //
translated: Since it is the entity of the dharmadhatu, it is unchanging because it is immutable and is also a basis because it is the basis of all of one’s own and others’ aims.

original: de nyid brtags pa'i rang bzhin ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par mi 'gyur ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid brtags pa'i rang bzhin ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par mi 'gyur ba'i gnas so //
translated: Since it is free from all imputed natures, it is not a natureless basis for change.

original: 'di nyid bsgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: This is taught in the proof.

original: sku mi 'gyur ba ma skyes pa //
analyzed: sku mi 'gyur ba ma skyes pa //
translated: The body is unchanging and unborn.

original: zhes pa ni gnyis pa dang bcu gsum par bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnyis pa dang bcu gsum par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained in the second and thirteenth chapters.

original: gsung dang thugs kyang mtshan ma med //
analyzed: gsung dang thugs kyang mtshan ma med //
translated: Speech and mind are also signless.

original: ces pa ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not have an imagined nature.🔽How can that appear?

original: de ci ltar na rab tu snang ba yin zhes dogs pas thag pa la sbrul du snang ba bzhin du de rab tu snang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci ltar na rab tu snang ba yin zhes dogs pas thag pa la sbrul du snang ba bzhin du de rab tu snang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It appears like a snake in a rope.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje la brtags pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid rnams de las byung ba'o ;
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje la brtags pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid rnams de las byung ba'o ;
translated: The eight consciousnesses, such as the consciousness of the ground of all, which are imagined in the vajra of space, arise from that.

original: / de ltar yang log par ni gzhan du ste gzung ba zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: / de ltar yang log par ni gzhan du ste gzung ba zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the false is otherwise, that is, the apprehended, which is the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: 'dzin pa yin zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun no //
translated: The apprehender is the seven engaging consciousnesses.

original: log par 'dzin pa ni mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa ni mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: False apprehension is unreal imagination.

original: des nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ma lus pa bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ma lus pa bsdus pa yin te /
translated: It includes all afflicted phenomena.

original: de ru de rnams 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ru de rnams 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in those.

original: gang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
analyzed: gang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
translated: The master Dignāga says:

original: 'dir ni gang zhig mi bden rtog / sems yin gang las gzhan de rtog / ji ltar rtogs pas brtags don gang //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang zhig mi bden rtog / sems yin gang las gzhan de rtog / ji ltar rtogs pas brtags don gang //
translated: Here, what is imagined is mind, and what is imagined by that is other than mind.

original: de ni shin tu yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni shin tu yod ma yin //
translated: The object imagined by that is utterly nonexistent.

original: de dag rgyu 'bras dngos po yis //
analyzed: de dag rgyu 'bras dngos po yis //
translated: By the things that are cause and effect,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: mind is asserted to be of two kinds.

original: gang zhig kun gzhi rnam shes grags //
analyzed: gang zhig kun gzhi rnam shes grags //
translated: That which is renowned as foundation consciousness

original: 'jug par grags pa rnam pa bdun //
analyzed: 'jug par grags pa rnam pa bdun //
translated: is renowned as the sevenfold collection.

original: nyon mongs bag chags sa bon ni //
analyzed: nyon mongs bag chags sa bon ni //
translated: Because the seeds of the latent afflictions are accumulated,

original: bsags pa'i phyir na sems zhes bya //
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir na sems zhes bya //
translated: it is called mind.

original: dang po'i rnam shes gnyis pa ni //
analyzed: dang po'i rnam shes gnyis pa ni //
translated: The first consciousness is the second,

original: sna tshogs rnam par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam par 'jug pa'o //
translated: which engages various objects.

original: de nas zhes pa gal te thams cad log par gzung bas 'dzin pa yin na de ltar na de ston par byed pa'i ngag kyang de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'i blo gros dman pa'i gdul bya'i bsam pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes
analyzed: de nas zhes pa gal te thams cad log par gzung bas 'dzin pa yin na de ltar na de ston par byed pa'i ngag kyang de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'i blo gros dman pa'i gdul bya'i bsam pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes
translated: if everything is apprehended as false, then in that case, it follows that the speech which teaches that is also like that.

original: la'o // 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rtsub pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: la'o // 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rtsub pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Gentle is soft, free from the roughness of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni dpal yin te @143b gang gi phun sum tshogs pa yin pa de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni dpal yin te @143b gang gi phun sum tshogs pa yin pa de la sogs pa'o //
translated: Glory is the accumulation of merit and wisdom, that by which there is abundance.

original: de'i bsam pa nyid kyis gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na sngar bzhin du rdo rje'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa nyid kyis gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na sngar bzhin du rdo rje'i tshig ste /
translated: By that very intention, the teaching of the Dharma with the twelve branches of excellent speech, which is characterized as just that, is just as before, a vajra statement.

original: de nyid phyin ci log tu 'byung bas phyin ci log gi gzung bar 'dzin pa nyid kyis mi brtag tu gsol zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid phyin ci log tu 'byung bas phyin ci log gi gzung bar 'dzin pa nyid kyis mi brtag tu gsol zhes brjod do //
translated: Since that very thing arises in a distorted way, it is said, “Please do not imagine that it is apprehended as a distorted object.”

original: tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'i phyir de zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'i phyir de zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: because it is established by valid cognition and scripture, one should refute it.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes pa ni rang nyid dogs nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes pa ni rang nyid dogs nas brjod pa'o //
translated: Why is that? is said out of one's own doubt.

original: gzhan gyis dris na gtam 'phro chad pa dang smra ba po mi mkhas par yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dris na gtam 'phro chad pa dang smra ba po mi mkhas par yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If asked by another, the conversation would be interrupted and the speaker would be unskilled.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ni rdo rje'i dbyings rnams yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ni rdo rje'i dbyings rnams yin te /
translated: The bodies, speech, and minds of all tathāgatas are the vajra realms.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi spyod pa rnams ni thams cad kyi gzugs ston pas sems can gyi don yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi spyod pa rnams ni thams cad kyi gzugs ston pas sems can gyi don yin no //
translated: Their intrinsic nature is the conduct that is the benefit of sentient beings by displaying all forms.

original: de rnams la gshegs pa dang byon pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po yin no //
analyzed: de rnams la gshegs pa dang byon pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po yin no //
translated: The going and coming of those is the lord of all tathāgatas.

original: gshegs pa ni dang po nyid du byang chub mngon sum du mdzad nas de ma thag tu sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni dang po nyid du byang chub mngon sum du mdzad nas de ma thag tu sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: Going is the direct realization of enlightenment for the first time, and buddhahood immediately after that.

original: byon pa ni gong nas gong du nus pa dang ldan pas rjes su byon pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byon pa ni gong nas gong du nus pa dang ldan pas rjes su byon pa nyid yin no //
translated: Coming is the subsequent arrival endowed with increasing ability.

original: khams rnams ma mkhyen pa dang snying rje dang mi ldan pa'i bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams rnams ma mkhyen pa dang snying rje dang mi ldan pa'i bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would be one who does not know the elements and is not endowed with compassion.

original: de gnyi ga yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir dang snying rje chen po la goms pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir dang snying rje chen po la goms pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since the Lord has realized the thatness of all things in all aspects and is endowed with great compassion, these two are not present in him.

original: de ci'i phyir mi bden pa'i don nyid dang de'i rdo rje'i tshig kyang yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir mi bden pa'i don nyid dang de'i rdo rje'i tshig kyang yin /
translated: Why is it that the meaning is not true, and why is it a vajra statement?

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa yang phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i ngo bos de bzhin ma yin pa'i don rnams rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa yang phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i ngo bos de bzhin ma yin pa'i don rnams rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa /
